properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues this morning. Rainfall totals of 50 to 75 mm will be possible by the time the rain and thunderstorms come to an end later this morning. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-18T21:59:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-18T12:27:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2394700076.2019
Area: Geraldton - Longlac - Caramat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Environment canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing loonie-sized hail and damaging winds in excess of 90 km/h. At 12:42 PM CDT Doppler RADAR indicated that this severe thunderstorm was located near Arden and was moving toward the south at 10 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles.
Expires: 2019-09-18T20:05:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-18T17:44:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1356280384.2019
Area: Mun. of Glenella-Lansdowne incl. Arden and Tenby

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winds will gust up to 90 kilometres per hour over these areas tonight. They will gradually diminish late overnight and Thursday morning. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-19T06:18:40-00:00

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 50 knots, frequent lightning, hail and poor to very poor visibility in thunderstorms heavy at times. The threat should diminish later today. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Some plants may be damaged or even destroyed by frost. Clear skies and light winds will allow ground temperatures to cool to near or below zero over many regions of the Maritimes tonight. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to PEstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #PEStorm.

properties.Title: Tropical Cyclone Information Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: For Hurricane Humberto. The next information statement will be issued by 09:00 p.m. ADT. Humberto will affect Bermuda late today and tonight. It will approach Canadian marine waters Thursday night into Friday, likely affecting the Scotian Slope, and then parts of the Grand Banks during the weekend. 1. Summary of basic information at 03:00 p.m. ADT. Location: 32.8 North 67.2 West. About 242 kilometres west of Bermuda. Maximum sustained winds: 195 kilometres per hour. Present movement: East-northeast at 30 kilometres per hour. Minimum central pressure: 952 millibars. 2. Public weather impacts and warnings summary. At this time no significant effects are expected over land. a. Wind. No significant wind expected. b. Rainfall. No significant rain expected. c. Surge/Waves. Swells may affect the Atlantic coast of Nova Scotia Friday, and southern Newfoundland during the weekend. 3. Marine weather impacts and warnings summary. Gale to Storm Force winds are likely over the Scotian Slope waters , Laurentian Fan, Banquereau Friday into Saturday, and then parts of the Grand Banks this weekend. As the winds increase, large waves will develop over offshore waters. Forecaster(s): Couturier. ### Please continue to monitor alerts issued by the Canadian Hurricane Centre and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-09-19T23:47:39-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-18T17:48:39-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3164698132.2019
Area: Avalon Peninsula Southeast, Avalon Peninsula Southwest
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and large hail. Thunderstorms continue this morning in parts of Manitoba. Severe weather is possible, with hail to the size of loonies and wind gusts in excess of 90 km/h the main threats. Thunderstorms will move eastward and northeastward throughout the day. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-18T23:50:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-18T15:52:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1550428118.2019
Area: Molson Lake and Bear Lake, Cross Lake and Jenpeg, Wabowden, Hwy 6 between Little Limestone Lake and Ponton, Norway House, Oxford House and Gods Lake, Red Sucker Lake, Island Lake

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 11:28 a.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. At 11:27 AM CDT Doppler RADAR indicated that this severe thunderstorm was located about 10 km north of Eddystone and was moving toward the north at 10 km/h. ### Fast-moving water across a road can sweep a vehicle away. Large hail can damage property and cause injury.
